content.description: Sit start with your left hand on the mini-rail, and right on the pinch side pull and move up the blunt arete.Someone has surely done this problem before, if so, let me know and I'll edit.
content.protection: Nothing is fine, or one pad.
content.location: Directly behind Humphrey's/Secondhand Smoke boulder about 100 feet.

content.description: Sit Start on the arete. Move up through a sloping ledge and top out directly above.
content.location: Small boulder directly behind the Humphry's/Secondhand Smoke boulder.

content.description: Slabby boulder with decent footing good for beginners and warm ups. Sit start and work straight up the slab.
content.location: Directly to the right of secondhand smoke on the same boulder in the middle of the large face

content.description: Located on the Humphrys Boulder, start left of Secondhand Smoke on the left side of the small boulder on the ground. Traverse right and head up the arete connecting with Secondhand Smoke.
content.location: Humphrys Boulder.   Head to back half of West View parking lot, the first small dirt/log staircase on your right. Head up, cross path, Humphry's boulder will be 20 yards to your right. May be harder to see in summer.

content.description: Sit start with right side pull.
content.location:
Walk up stairs from the middle of the West View Parking Lot, cross directly over the path and walk into the forest. You will see a few small boulders and the Parking Lot Boulder will be at 2:00. You should be able to see the top of it over the other boulders. 

  Be careful of broken glass.

content.description: Sit start at base of arete (same as Secondhand Smoke) and move up to the side-pull pocket then break off right and finish up the slab. You can also just cut right from the starting holds. Original description:'Climb just right of the overhang from two ledges to a sidepull-pocket (Right hand). pull a very small crimper (Right of the arete and with the left hand) to a bigger one on the right (right hand). Pull left on a little crimp (Left hand) and down on your bigger one (Right hand) and grab the top.'
content.location: Humphry's Boulder in West View Parking Lot.

content.description: Stand start and follow fun path up the right side of the arete.
content.location: Located just to the right of Tin Rood Blues, on the right hand arete of the Humphrey's Boulder

content.description: Start with the high rail to the right of Apple Slab Pie and the foot at the base of the boulder - go straight up! Short route but very accessible. Best done with a few nearby friends giving advice all at once.
content.location: Directly right of Apple Slab Pie on the Fridge boulder.

content.description: Sit start on a right facing hold, move left to a low jug and make a big reach to top out.
content.location: Located on the backside of the boulder just behind and to the left of Humphrey's Boulder.

content.description: Stand start on right blocky edge of boulder. Traverse left across crimp rail and top out over the left arete.
content.location: The second boulder behind and left of the Humphrey's Boulder

content.description: Stand start on crimp rail in center of face. Finish directly above on sloping bulge for top out.
content.location: The second boulder behind and left of the Humphrey's Boulder

content.description: Start low on the obvious arete, bump your way up until you can hit the jug and top out.
content.location: The second boulder behind and left of the Humphrey's Boulder

content.description: Stand start on good left pinch and nice right crimp. Move up and right, fun footwork to top out
content.location: Located on the boulder just behind and to the left of Humphrey's Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with decent left sidepull and sharp horizontal right hand crimp. Move up into the start of Nothing Left to Lose and follow to top out.
content.location: Located on the boulder just behind and to the left of Humphrey's Boulder.

content.description:
Stand started on side pulls and finish straight above.

 video beta - youtube.com/watch?v=doVSQe3…
content.location:
Located under the stone fort overlook at the base of the West View parking lot.

 When driving to lot you will see fort on your left. Walk back down to the fort, locate the blue trail on the right (north) side of the fort and do a light bushwhack to the base of the overlook. This will be the first free standing boulder you come to.

 If you come to the intersection of the blue and white trail you've gone too far.

content.description: Shares a start with Secondhand Smoke. Sit start on large edges, move up and right and traverse along the middle of the boulder, topping out on the right arete, sharing a top out with The Right Side of Fun.

Sit start on the left of the overhanging face with the small rock at your back.  Use opposing holds on the small bulge as for Third Degree Burn, but rather than traversing right, follow diagonal crimps up to a good jug on the lip and top out.
content.location: On the Humphrys Boulder uphill from the Westview parking lot.

content.description:
Stand start beneath the bulge. Originally done with a mono and shallow undercling and feet on the base. Bust out over the bulge to some good holds and paw your way up some hard-to-see slopey crimps up high. Spicy finish.

 Video beta: vimeo.com/148974851
content.location:
Located under the stone fort overlook at the base of the West View parking lot.

 When driving to lot you will see fort on your left. Walk back down to the fort, locate the blue trail on the right (north) side of the fort and do a light bushwhack to the base of the overlook. 

 The first boulder you may come across is The Fridge. Keep walking past this and parallel to overlook. The Bulge is on the SW corner of a large free standing boulder.

 If you come to the intersection of the blue and white trail you've gone too far.

content.description: Stand start with sidepulls on large pie slice shaped rock, follow the crack straight up
content.location: On the back side of the Fridge boulder, below the overlook

content.description: Shady, right off the path, lots of random boulders with a few quality set ups for bouldering.
